description: GitHub integration for repository management, issues, pull requests, and project coordination

required.name: GITHUB_TOKEN
required.description: GitHub Personal Access Token with repo, issues, and pull request permissions
required.scope: Repository access, issue management, pull request operations
howToGenerate: 1. Go to GitHub Settings > Developer settings > Personal access tokens
3. Select scopes: repo, read:org, read:user, read:project
4. Copy the generated token to your environment

securityConsiderations: Token should have minimal required permissions
Use organization-specific tokens for team repositories
Store tokens securely in environment variables
Monitor token usage through GitHub audit logs

commonIssues.solution: Verify token is correct and has required permissions. Generate new token if expired.
Update token permissions to include 'repo' scope for private repositories.
Implement request throttling and use authenticated requests for higher limits.

examples.description: Analyze and create response for GitHub issue
examples.prompt: Analyze GitHub issue #123 and create a detailed response with solution suggestions

examples.description: Review pull request for code quality
examples.prompt: Review pull request #456 for code quality, security issues, and best practices

examples.description: Create release notes from recent commits
examples.prompt: Generate release notes for version 2.1.0 based on commits since last release

limits.rateLimit: 5000 requests per hour for authenticated requests
limits.dataAccess: Access limited to repositories token has permissions for
limits.operations: Read/write operations based on token scope
